intro: Hieracium intybus, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa, and has been introduced to other regions including North America. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 cm. Its leaves are hairy and alternate, while its yellow flowers are arranged in a flat-topped cluster. It is known for its ability to spread rapidly through both seeds and rhizomes, making it a common weed in agricultural areas.
